title: Song and scenery;
author: Moffat, James C.
snippet: It is the subject  of one of Sir Walter Scott's inimitable descriptions. The " Grey Mare's Tail " is eight miles and a half from the town of Moffat ; and in going to it, one passes over a variety of interesting scenery — Craigie Hill, down by Craigie Burn, and through the shades of Craigie Burn wood, the subject  of one, or rather two, of Burns' songs.
